intro: Nicolsonia barbata, commonly known as the barbed nicolsonia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its unique barbed bracts give it its common name and contribute to its distinctive appearance. While not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its ecological significance in high-altitude environments.
